message.content:
cs.NE, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI. 

The paper discusses the use of multidimensional recurrent neural networks (MDRNNs) for speech and handwriting recognition, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision (CV). The paper also discusses the use of Hessian-free optimization for training deep MDRNNs, which falls under the category of neural networks and machine learning (NE). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.NE. However, since the paper also discusses the use of connectionist temporal classification (CTC) as an objective for learning MDRNNs, it could also belong to the sub-categories of computational linguistics (CL) and machine learning (LG). Additionally, since the paper discusses the use of MDRNNs for speech and handwriting recognition, it could also belong to the sub-categories of computer vision (CV) and artificial intelligence (AI).
